title: finding a font for ink jet printing.
content:
Does anyone know of any sans serif & serif fonts that print well under an ink jet resolution bwt 1200 and 2400? Or is this impossible?

Thanks

 [‹ the Underground](http://web.archive.org/web/20071101141520/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18020 "Go to previous forum topic") [Henk Krijger / Raffia Initials ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071101141520/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10336 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Joseph

comments.content: Depends on the printer, the driver and the paper...
Avoid thin serifs. Avoid going too small. Test direction. Generally, stick to name brand ink. Using the re-furbished toner cartridges is asking for a nightmare. Bolder is better than thinner.

I think Charter is great for lo-fi.  
But a matching sans, hmmm...

hhp

Perhaps Swift of Gulliver (serif) or Vesta (sans) by Gerard Unger?
